TopicTitle: How do you have your subscription settings set?

Articles.Content:
There several modes of subscription for this forum, and I was wondering what people use most:

Manual subscription options (You have to select "Subscribe" in thread tools):

Through my control panel only.

Instantly, using email.

Daily, using email.

Weekly, using email. 

Automatic subscription options (When you post in a thread, a subscription is added):

Through my control panel only. This is what I use, you can see new posts in "Settings"

Instantly, using email.

Daily, using email.

Weekly, using email.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-15T22:08:18Z" title="07/15/2015 10:08  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 15, 2015</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**

I voted "Other" because I have no idea how my subscription settings are set. I don't use the feature.

I browse the KSP forums like I do every forum I browse: By the "latest threads since your last visit" page. I have a bookmark to [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search.php?do=getnew&contenttype=vBForum_Post](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search.php?do=getnew&contenttype=vBForum_Post) and that's the only way I ever visit the forum.

That page nicely summarizes what has happened since my last visit. Usually I check every thread that I've replied to that I also care about, and on the first page or 2 I read all the titles and see if there's anything new I want to reply to.
I ALWAYS use the control panel.

I manually sub to the threads of mods I'm interested in, and check through my 'mods' subscription folder in the control panel when I look for updates.

(AUTO) Instant email.

This means I don't have to keep the forums open in a tab on my browser all the time, and that I can quickly respond to enquiries.
